abstract: The deal will bolster Capital One’s portfolio of credit card loans, while allowing HSBC to further slim down its consumer banking operations in the United States.
snippet: The deal will bolster Capital One’s portfolio of credit card loans, while allowing HSBC to further slim down its consumer banking operations in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Capital One Financial agreed early Wednesday to buy the United States credit card business of HSBC Holdings for $2.6 billion in cash and stock, in what will be Capital One’s second major deal with a European firm in recent months.

headline.main: Capital One to Buy HSBC’s U.S. Card Unit for $2.6 Billion

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
